lessons.japanese: 君の愚痴はもう聞きたくないよ。
lessons.english: I don't want to hear any more of your complaining.

lessons.japanese: 君の愚痴はもう聞きたくないよ。
lessons.english: I don't want to hear any more of your complaining.

lessons.japanese: 君の相変わらずの愚痴には、むかつくよ。
lessons.english: I'm fed up with your constant complaining.

lessons.japanese: 君の愚痴を聞かされるのはうんざりだ。
lessons.english: I'm sick of listening to your complaints.

lessons.japanese: 家内の愚痴を聞くのはもううんざりしています。
lessons.english: I'm sick of listening to her complaints.

lessons.japanese: 「うちの愛妻がケチでさー」「のろけてる？愚痴ってる？」
lessons.english: "My wonderful wife is so stingy that ..." "You boasting? Or complaining?"

lessons.japanese: 彼女の愚痴は聞き飽きた。
lessons.english: I'm fed up with her grumbling.

lessons.japanese: 彼女の愚痴は私をむだにいらだたせる。
lessons.english: She irritates me to no end with her complaints.

lessons.japanese: 彼は本当に愚痴愚痴言う。
彼は酒を飲むと、息子の愚痴をこぼすのがお決まりだ。
lessons.english: He never drinks without complaining about his son.

lessons.japanese: 彼は私にあうといつも自分の奥さんの愚痴を言う。
lessons.english: He never sees me without complaining about his wife.

lessons.japanese: 一日中、愚痴をこぼしてばかりいる。
lessons.english: He does nothing but complain all day long.

lessons.japanese: 彼のお母さんはそのことで絶えず愚痴をこぼしています。
lessons.english: His mother is constantly complaining about it.

lessons.japanese: 私は彼女の愚痴にはうんざりしている。
lessons.english: I'm fed up with her complaints.
